definition: to split heaven and earth apart (idiom); refers to the Pangu 盤古|盘古[Pan2 gu3] creation myth

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
day/sky/heaven
to open (a door)/to open up (for development)/to dispel/to refute/to repudiate
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: In your own words, retell the legend, 'The Beginning of the World'
sentences.chinese: 用自己的話講述“盤古開天闢地”的故事。

sentences.english: At the very early stage, mankind used the creation of the world to tell natural time.
sentences.chinese: 人類初期用開天闢地的故事講述自然時間。

sentences.english: This is the history of an epoch-making event.
sentences.chinese: 這是中國歷史上開天闢地的大事件。

sentences.english: That has been true since the world began.
sentences.chinese: 開天闢地以來，那便是真理。

sentences.english: From the epoch-making event, reflects the difficult situation of the capital.
sentences.chinese: 開天闢地的退出事件，折射出資本的艱難處境。

sentences.english: When the eternal ancestors arose, in the Dreamtime, they wandered the earth.
sentences.chinese: 當祖先們從開天闢地時期醒來，他們就在大地上游蕩。

sentences.english: Wang and Pangu an epoch-making story in the civil widely circulated.
sentences.chinese: 而盤古王開天闢地故事在民間廣爲流傳。

definition: to travel around the country

principle of people's livelihood, the third of Dr Sun Yat-sen's 孫中山|孙中山 Three Principles of the People 三民主義|三民主义 (at the time, meaning redistribution of wealth, self-sufficiency and internal trade)
